intro: Hosackia disticha, commonly known as the slender false indigo, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has compound leaves with oval-shaped leaflets and produces seed pods that split open at maturity. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in prairies and along stream banks.
